text: The 2003–04 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the eleventh season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== == Squad of the champions Baník Ostrava == ;Goalkeepers * Michal Daněk, Jan Laštůvka, Martin Raška ; Defenders * Pavel Besta, René Bolf, Peter Drozd, Josef Dvorník, Josef Hoffmann, Aleš Neuwirth, Zdeněk Pospěch ; Midfielders * David Bystroň, Martin Čížek, Rostislav Kiša, Radoslav Látal, Mario Lička, Miroslav Matušovič, Radek Slončík ; Forwards * Marek Heinz, Přemysl Krpec, Lukáš Magera, Martin Prohászka,After the first half of the season, Prohászka moved to FK Viktoria Žižkov. Adam Varadi, Libor Žůrek ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Marek Heinz |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |19 |- !2 |align="left"| Lubomír Reiter |align="left"|Sigma Olomouc |15 |- !3 |align="left"| David Lafata |align="left"|České Budějovice |14 |- !4 |align="left"| Milan Pacanda |align="left"|Brno |12 |- !rowspan="2"|5 |align="left"| Filip Dort |align="left"|Opava |rowspan="2"|11 |- |align="left"| Karel Poborský |align="left"|Sparta Prague |- !rowspan="2"|7 |align="left"| Libor Došek |align="left"|Slovan Liberec |rowspan="2"|10 |- |align="left"| Miroslav Matušovič |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |- !9 |align="left"| Zdeněk Pospěch |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |9 |} ==See also== * 2003–04 Czech Cup * 2003–04 Czech 2.
